summary:
The Olympic Games are the biggest international sports events, held every four years. They include summer and winter sports, with athletes from over 200 countries participating. The idea came from ancient Greek games. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) was formed in 1894, and the first modern Olympics were in Athens in 1896.

Over time, the Olympics have changed. Winter Games were added for snow sports, and there are now Youth Olympics and Paralympic Games for athletes with disabilities. The IOC runs the Games, decides which sports are included, and chooses the host cities.

The Olympics are famous for their rituals, like the opening ceremony and medal awards. They bring countries together but also face challenges like doping and boycotts.
title: Olympic Games
